body.p:
To His Excellency
Thomas E Bramlett, "Governor"
Commonwealth of Kentucky,
Frankfort Kentucky.
At the August Term of Campbell Circuit Court, 1865 --
Ferdinand Winterhalter a Tavern Keeper at this place Alexandria was Indicted for Selling Liquor to a Minor, and a fine assessed against him of $50.00 Dollars.

The Circumstances under which he was fined in the opinion of your petitioners deserve the interposition of your Excellency, Mr Winterhalter a German by birth has been a Citizen of this town for Several years, and has invariably been Strictly a law abiding man, and the minor who he is reported to of Sold Liquor to is one William Nelson who to all apperance was past the age of Twenty one, but the evidence
in Court, proved him to be under that age, "with Shame a Father" makes that claim, after having several years allowed him to deal and carry on affairs for himself, believing as your petitioners do that offences of selling to minors Should be punished with the extremity of the Law, but in this instance Such was not the fact, for he is and was an adult in apperance & transactions.

Mr Winterhalter died but a few days ago and left a wife & 45 children, with but little inheritence who must now battle with the world unprotected, We feel that your charitable hand will and should be extended in this Case, as in duty bound your petitioners will ever pray, Sept 29th 1865

Thomas Jones
W, H, Thomas D, C, C, C. Court
C. Smith
R. Riggall
Peter Kronz P. M.
Ph Gerlach

Campbell Cir Ct
vs
F. Winterhalter
$50,
Selling liquor to minor
Remitted 3d Oct 1865
